p: Results of the scanning electron microscope (SEM) of pearl spar samples showed a quantity of collections with tiny arrangement. The SEM images, engaged at the same resolution of 1 mm, showed the shiny, porousness and malleable nature of the atom present. The actual calcination also ensued in the sintering of minor mineral collections and agglomerated atoms, which takes into action the malleable nature. It has been established that calcination always averts ooze of potassium, and may proliferate the reusability of catalyst [53].
